ygData.subject: Unpostponing Rock of Ages

Subject: Unpostponing Rock of Ages
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"

Unidentified Cybertronians:




Deep within Predacon territory the most powerful crime syndicate had been cut 
down by several unidentified individuals.  The Defcons had once been the key 
players, their leader Alabastor working his way up from the gutters and 
taking control of most crime activity within the Predacon Alliance.  But he 
made a pact with some new people that jumped onto the scene.  They 
slaughtered a troublesome gang that seemed impossible to track because of its 
small size though they packed a whallop, killing a dozen Defcons and stealing 
thousands in contraband.

Unfortunately Alabastor had tried to kill off these individuals (their price 
was quite high), but it backfired.  All his major lieutenants were almost 
instantly killed, many of his shipments stolen, the brunt of his private army 
crushed, and basically all his assets razed.  Then he, or what was left of 
him, was discovered in some backwater Predacon city in some dark alley.

With the Defcons obliterated, dozens of smaller crime syndicates moved to 
take control of everything the Defcons had lost.  A large crime war waged for 
several months, resulting in the death of over a thousand Predacons.  This 
gained the interest of the Maximals, interested because they had positive 
proof of the deaths but the Predacon Alliance denied it.  They were 
determined to find out what happened, no matter the cost.



Rewind watched the party, taking a sip from his liquid energon.  It was 
alcoholic but it wasn't that strong.  These type of dinner parties involving 
rich Cybertronians was kind of boring in Rewind's opinion, but it came with 
the job.

"Ah, Abucus, welcome.  I trust you are enjoying yourself?"

Abucus.  Yes, that was the name Rewind was using.  But then again, even 
Rewind was a false name.  No one ever used his real name.  Not even his 
superiors, who just use his code name, Rewind.  Every mission required a new 
name and a new identity.

"Senator Raccon, it is good to see you again.  This party is not without its 
class, but I am on a t--"

"Say no more," the Predacon Senator replied with a smile, "who am I to keep a 
representative of Technology Inc. on hold?"  The Senator shook 'Abucus' hand 
and walked up to a podium, his voice booming over loud speakers that couldn't 
be seen.  A dozen heads turned his way.  All representatives of the most 
powerful Predacon corporations.  Including a division of Shuko Inc., 
PredaTech Labs, creators of the Oblitercons.  

"I know you are all here have waited a while now, and with good reason," 
Senator Raccon began, "you all know why you're here.  To purchase the latest 
in Predacon technology.  True it is two years old, but it is years ahead of 
its time.  This capital starship was built by the Predacon Alliance, but 
stolen by the petty thugs the Defcons.  They are dead now, and recently this 
craft was discovered at an abandoned warehouse.  Soldiers loyal to me were 
able to secure it and scientists loyal to me were able to examine it."

"It is a large warship, its whereabouts are--well, that information will be 
reserved for the individuals who purchase it.  Anyway, moving on, the ship is 
approximately several hundred feet long, several hundred feet wide." A screen 
appeared behind Roccon, who stepped out of the way, a smooth purely black 
ship in the shape of a cigar displayed on it.  

"Most impressive." someone next to Rewind said.

"Indeed." another replied.

Rewind shook his head, knowing anyone who spoke like that would never be able 
to afford such machinery.

"This ship is one of the fastest ever manufactured with hyperspace and 
transwarp cells.  It is equipped with maps of all Cybertronian, Nebulan, and 
Human explored space.  It has advanced scanning equipment, you could pick out 
a match in a giant human landfill from everything else.  The scanning 
equipment can penetrate most shields and armor and its range is as great as 
the Megatronian Satellite.  It is equipped with a full science bay and room 
for a three hundred person crew.  In the way of armarment, it is equipped 
with several laser batteries and five plasma batteries.  It is armed with a 
full array of missile tubes and a few hidden surprises."

"As you can tell, this is a most impressive ship.  Bidding on the White 
Lighting shall begin at 500,000 credits.  Do I here 500,000?"

"500,000!"

"550,000!"

"650,000!"

"800,000!"

Rewind looked to the two idiots next to him for a quick second.  He found it 
hard to believe a pair of losers like them had that kind of money, but 
stranger things had happened.  It was time for him to bag this, the 
information and the designs of the ship would serve the Maximals well.  
"35,000,000!" he yelled.  The room was quiet for a few moments.

"Do I hear 35,000,000?  Anyone?  Anyone?  Going once, going twice, s--"

"50,000,000 credits!" a robot in a far corner yelled.  

The Senator smiled, with good reason.  Sure, he could've returned the ship to 
the Predacon Alliance.  He could've become a hero and gotten a big promotion. 
 But what would be the point?  Be a prominent figure in a worthless Alliance? 
 He would rather be rich.  "Any--"

"75,000,000." one of the two robots next to Rewind responded.

"1,500,000,000." the robot who offered 50,000,000 said.

"5,000,000,000!" Rewind yelled.  He had a limit of ten billion credits to 
spend.  If he couldn't buy the ship, he'd have to find its whereabouts and 
attempt to commandeer it.  If he couldn't commandeer it, he was to blow the 
craft up and kill the Senator and some of his key men.  He prefered to buy 
it.  

"6,000,000,000!" 

"7,000,000,000!"  

"7,000,000,000 dude?  Come on!"

"Shut up, man, we can still buy The Bronze."

"We better, they've got good music.  And lots of...huge tracks of land." Both 
robots chuckled, Rewind shaking his head.

"8,000,000,000!" he offered.

"9,500,000,000!" the man in the corner who had originally offered 50 million 
yelled.

"10,000,000,000!" Rewind yelled.  He was hoping no one else had that kind of 
money.

"Dude, don't offer anymore.  If we go above ten billion we won't have any 
cash left over to buy The Bronze."

"But we didn't plan on p--"

"Don't say that outloud!" one of the two 'idiot' robots yelled, slapping the 
other.

"Fifteen billion credits!" the robot who had been slapped.  "Mess with me, 
eh?  I don't care about The Bronze that much.  We'll still have enough to 
purchase their huge tracks of land anyway."

Rewind cursed.  He noticed the other robot who had been a highroller in the 
bidding was angry as well.

"Sold!  For 15,000,000,000!" Raccon yelled happily.  He had only expected at 
the most a few billion credits.  With this kind of money he could begin down 
payments on financing his improved private army.  "Congratulations..." Raccon 
searched through his databanks, "Poison and Quiet Riot of Heavy Metal 
Interplanetary Computron Company..."

Odd name, Rewind thought.

Poison and Quiet Riot headed up to the podium.  Posion was jumping up and 
down.  "Alright!  This is awesome.  White Lightening.  Def Leppard.  It all 
works out man!"

"Totally!" Posion yelled.  "Awesome.  Far out.  Psychadelic.  Neato."

"Neato?"

"Indeed."

The Senator shook his head in annoyance.  "We will immediately show you to 
the White Lightening, as soon as you pay the money."

Reaching into a subspace pocket, Poison produced a datapad.  He entered a few 
numbers and handed it to the Senator, who handed it to an aide of his.

"It checks out." the aide said.  "This is fifteen billion credits right here."

The Senator handed Quiet Riot a datapad.  "That's all the information you'll 
need to visit the White Lightening."

"Thanks, Mr. Senator.  Man, Def, Dokken, and Judas have been looking for this 
since they killed Alabastor."

Silence filled the room.

Interesting, Rewind thought, ready to pull a weapon from subspace.

"Idiot!" Poison yelled at Quiet Riot.  "I know we were going to kill them 
anyway, but did you have to tell them Def, Dokken, and Judas killed that 
weakling Alabastor and killed the Defcons?  Damn!  Look what you made me say!"

The several armed Predacon guards were tense, a few of them moving closer 
towards the podium while the Senator backed off, gripping the datapad worth 
fifteen billion credits tightly.

Poison turned quickly, what looked like a wooden drumstick (for drums, not a 
chicken or turkey :), a blue bolt of energy striking the aide, who collapsed, 
mech-fluid leaking in large amounts from his chest as he lay dead on the 
floor.

Quiet Riot pulled out what looked like an acoustic guitar though made of 
metal.  He swung it like a club at an incoming guard, cracking his head open 
like a melon.  

"Get them!" the Senator yelled, the remaining guards opening fire on Poison 
and Quiet Riot with laser rifles.

The Senator pressed his hand against a portion of the wall, a small hole in 
the wall appearing.  Raccon quickly climbed through.  He didn't care about 
those guards, the aides, or those buyers.  He had fifteen billion credits!  
Besides, he'd call his guards at the site of the White Ligthening and tell 
them to beef up security greatly.  Perhaps he could sell the craft for 
another dozen billion credits to finance his army.

Rewind reached into subspace, a custom laser rifle appearing in his hand.  He 
raised it, firing off two bolts, superheated laser energy cutting into the 
back of one of the Predacon guards.  Charging forward and jumping over the 
downed guard, Rewind fired off a few more shots, cutting down another 
Predacon guard. 

Poison ducked under a few shots rather easily, firing off another blue blast, 
this time cutting down one of the buyers.  He chuckled, leaping off the 
stage, jump kicking a Predacon guard.  He swung around, a laser bolt stabbing 
into his chest.  His armor held up though, and he shot back, killing the 
guard instantly.

Quiet Riot pulled on the end of his acoustic, part of it coming out, 
revealing itself to be an energy blade.  He tossed the other part into 
subspace.  He pointed his blade at Rewind, but a missile struck his chest, 
sending him flipping backwards and crashing to the ground.

The robot who had bidded 50,000,000 stepped forward, a tube-like thing 
sticking out of his left forearm.  Another rocket shot out, this time blowing 
apart a Predacon guard.  Several more guards piled through a door, opening 
fire, cutting down a few buyers in the crossfire.

Rewind charged forward, a roundhouse kick taking down a Predacon guard.  A 
few laser bolts caught him in the abdomen but his armor was more than enough 
to take it.  He shoved the barrel of his laser rifle into the chest of one of 
the guards, firing off a few bolts into the guard's chest killing him 
instantly.

The armed buyer fired off another missile, missing its target and exploding 
against the wall.  Quiet Riot was back on his feet, a large dent in his 
chest.  "That sucked.  Let's get out of here!" he yelled, pointing his blade 
at the buyer, the energy blade firing off two small spheres of yellow energy. 
 The blasts knocked the buyer back, but he kept firing rockets, blowing holes 
in the walls.

Quiet Riot smashed his way through the wall with surprising strength, Poison 
firing off a few blasts as cover fire, following Quiet Riot quick.

Rewind cursed, firing off five rapid blasts, taking down two Predacons.  The 
remaining few Predacons fled, the buyer firing off two rockets into the 
middle of the other buyers who were bunched up.  Rewind didn't care that they 
were all either dead or dying.  He charged at the armed buyer, firing off two 
bolts with little effect.  He put his laser rifle into subspace, tackling the 
buyer to the ground.  A few punches to the face seemed to knock him 
unconscious.  Standing up Rewind thought for a split second.  He would've 
liked to interrogate the buyer, who fired on the killers and guards alike.  
But he had to chase Quiet Riot and Poison who obviously knew about the 
Defcons.  He ran through the hole the duo had made.  Using internal scanners, 
he was able to follow the them by tracking the microscopic amount of 
mech-fluid Quiet Riot was leaking from the attack.


The buyer stood up quickly, looking around.  His internal clock told him he'd 
been out for about a minute.  He got up quickly, deactivating his rocket 
weapon.  He activated his comm. unit.  "This is Chriom.  I've found those 
responsible and I've learned the White Lightening exists.  I've lost them for 
the moment, but I know a way to track them though."

~Good, Chriom.  Did you find the names out?~

"Yes, Poison and Quiet Riot.  But those names aren't in any databases, 
Maximal or Predacon.  I will continue searching all sources for any kind of 
name."  Chriom walked out the door, two armed Predacons approaching him.  His 
cyan optics glowed for a moment, laser blasts piercing into chests of the 
Predacons and killing them. Chriom continued on his way.
